Package team1351.purepursuit

Class PathFollower

  • java.lang.Object
    • PathFollower
  • public class PathFollower
extends java.lang.Object
    Path Follower Object that allows the robot to follow the path. This contains functions for generating the left and right feed-forward wheel velocities for the wheels based on a given robot position and heading. Some calculations are based off of team 1712's paper: https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/paper-implementation-of-the-adaptive-pure-pursuit-controller/166552
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Owen Leather

    • Field Detail

      • path

        private Path path
        Current path to follow

      • lookaheadDistance

        private double lookaheadDistance
        Lookahead distance of the path follower. The lookahead distance determines the distance that the lookahead point is away from the robot. The higher the lookahead distance, the larger the turns the robot makes are. More information at: https://www.mathworks.com/help/robotics/ug/pure-pursuit-controller.html#burwbfa

      • currentLookaheadDistance

        private double currentLookaheadDistance
        The current lookahead distance that is slightly changed based on the closest pre-generated point.

      • previousPointIndex

        private int previousPointIndex
        The index of the previous closest point.

      • currentClosestPoint

        private TrajectoryPoint currentClosestPoint
        The current closest TrajectoryPoint to the robot. This determines the robot's base velocity.

      • WHEEL_DISTANCE

        private double WHEEL_DISTANCE
        The distance between the wheels on the chassis, also known as the track width.

      • reversed

        private boolean reversed
        If the robot should follow the path reversed. If this is true, the robot will be following the path backwards

      • currentRadius

        private double currentRadius

      • currentLookaheadPoint

        private TrajectoryPoint currentLookaheadPoint

    • Constructor Detail

      • PathFollower

        public PathFollower​(Path path)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        path - the path to follow

      • PathFollower

        public PathFollower​(Path path,
                    boolean reversed)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        path - the path to follow
        reversed - whether or not the output should be reversed, resulting in the robot following the path backwards.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public PathFollowerOutput update()
        Updates the path follower. Master update function to return the left and right feed-forward wheel velocity values. These values are returned in the form of a PathFollowerOutput.
        Returns:
        A PathFollowerOutput object with the left and right feed-forward wheel velocity values.

      • calculateCurvature

        private double calculateCurvature​(double robotX,
                                  double robotY,
                                  double robotHeading)
        Calculates the curvature of the arc from the robot to the lookahead point.
        Parameters:
        robotX - robot's current X position.
        robotY - robot's current Y position.
        robotHeading - robot's current heading angle (degrees).
        Returns:
        the curvature of the arc from the robot's position to the lookahead point.

      • findClosestPoint

        private TrajectoryPoint findClosestPoint​(double x,
                                         double y)
        Finds the closest point to the robot. This point is used to determine the robot's base forward velocity.
        Parameters:
        x - the robot's current X position.
        y - the robot's current Y position.
        Returns:
        a TrajectoryPoint that is the closest point on the path to the robot.

      • findLookaheadPoint

        private TrajectoryPoint findLookaheadPoint​(double x,
                                           double y)
        Finds the lookahead point based on the robot's current position and the lookahead distance. The lookahead point is the point that the robot follows on the path. This function finds the closest point on the path that is ahead of the findClosestPoint(double, double) that is lookahead distance away from the robot.
        Parameters:
        x - the robot's current X position.
        y - the robot's current Y position.
        Returns:
        a TrajectoryPoint that is the lookahead point on the path.

      • getCurrentClosestPoint

        public TrajectoryPoint getCurrentClosestPoint()
        Returns the current closest point to the robot.
        Returns:
        the TrajectoryPoint that is the current closest point on the path to the robot.

      • setLookaheadDistance

        public void setLookaheadDistance​(double lookaheadDistance)
        Sets the lookahead distance value.
        Parameters:
        lookaheadDistance - the lookahead distance value.

      • getLookaheadDistance

        public double getLookaheadDistance()
        Returns the lookahead distance value.
        Returns:
        the lookahead distance value.

      • setWheelDistance

        public void setWheelDistance​(double WHEEL_DISTANCE)
        Sets the wheel distance value. The wheel distance is the distance between the wheels on the chassis, also known as the track width.
        Parameters:
        WHEEL_DISTANCE - the wheel distance value.

      • getWheelDistance

        public double getWheelDistance()
        Returns the wheel distance value of the path follower.
        Returns:
        the wheel distance value.

      • getCurvature

        public double getCurvature()

      • getCurrentLookaheadPoint

        public TrajectoryPoint getCurrentLookaheadPoint()

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Function that checks whether or not the path following is finished. This is determined by if the currentClosestPoint is the last point of the path.
        Returns:
        if the path follower is finished following the path.
